intro.title: Nico Iseli
intro.description: UX Enthusiast with a passion for creating useful and engaging product solutions

intro.title: About
intro.description: I have always had a passion for creating things. During my studies in computer science, and especially through my major in Human Computer Interaction Design, a great interest in UX arose in me. What I particularly like about this area is the interplay of different disciplines such as design, technology, psychology, communication and so on. That‘s why I decided to pursue a career in this field and I am extremely motivated to help shape the digital future.

entries.description: Bachelor's degree in computer science with a major in Human Computer Interaction Design.
Change of degree program from Information Systems to Computer Science after the first semester.
The vocational baccalaureate enables the enrollment at Swiss universities of applied sciences in a specific field. For this course, the focus was placed on the field of economics.
Commercial apprenticeship in the insurance industry. In addition to practical experience, the basics of business administration and economics were taught.

entries.title: Lead UX Designer
entries.description: In this role, I am responsible for company-wide digital product design, redesigning the current product landscape, supporting the strategic development of the company and conceptualizing and designing financial planning features.

entries.title: Entrepreneur
entries.description: In addition to my professional employments, I co-founded a startup with three other friends, focusing on consulting and providing services in the digital realm, along with developing digital products.

entries.title: UX / UI Designer
entries.description: In this role, I was responsible for planning, implementing and in some cases managing various UX projects. Depending on the project, tasks in the areas of design systems, user research, conception, visual design or testing were involved.

entries.title: Research Assistant
entries.description: In this role, I was responsible for creating and implementing concepts for future forms of teaching as a result of the Covid-19 pandemic.

leisure-time.title: Leisure Time
leisure-time.description: While UX is undeniably a passion of mine, I believe that a fulfilling and interesting life requires a balance with engaging leisure activities. I like to spend my free time doing outdoor sports, such as ski touring, surfing, mountain biking, cycling or hiking. Additionally, I find joy in pursuing creative hobbies such as photography, drawing, illustration, and experimenting with new recipes in the kitchen. These activities not only provide me with a sense of relaxation but also fuel my creativity and inspire fresh perspectives.
